SRP.A: The peak of  Dining is to the {left} of the peak of Nightlife.

EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Transportation} has the highest peak.

EVJ.A: At X =757.3,the label with the highest density is {Transportation}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 4888? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Shopping}'s peak at {5646},{Dining}'s peak at {7758},{Adventure Activities}'s peak at {8278},{Cultural Experiences}'s peak at {5295},{Nightlife}'s peak at {8448}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 6902? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Shopping}'s peak at {5646},{Transportation}'s peak at {1071},{Cultural Experiences}'s peak at {5295}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Nightlife or Adventure Activities?
NC.A: {Nightlife} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Cultural Experiences or Dining?
NC.A: {Dining} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Transportation or Nightlife?
NC.A: {Nightlife} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {5} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Transportation}
